title: Original TV Anime 'Pon no Michi' Announced for Winter 2024
text:
An official website opened on Tuesday for an original television anime titled Pon no Michi and revealed the main cast, production staff, teaser visual (pictured), and teaser promotional video. The anime is scheduled to premiere in January 2024.

Cast
Nashiko Jippensha: Kaori Maeda (Isekai de Cheat Skill wo Te ni Shita Ore wa, Genjitsu Sekai wo mo Musou Suru)
Pai Kawahigashi: Iori Saeki (Shokei Shoujo no Virgin Road)
Izumi Tokutomi: Shion Wakayama (Lycoris Recoil)
Riche Hayashi: Yui Kondou (Ore no Nounai Sentakushi ga, Gakuen Love Comedy wo Zenryoku de Jama Shiteiru)

Staff
Original Story: IIS-P
Director, Script: Tatsuma Minamikawa (Enen no Shouboutai: Ni no Shou, Nami yo Kiitekure)
Original Character Design: Negi Haruba (5-toubun no Hanayome, Sentai Daishikkaku)
Character Design: Kenji Oota (Lance N' Masques, Toji no Miko chief animation director)
Color Design: Emi Kadono (Youkai Watch)
Art Director: Scott MacDonald (Arte, Kenja no Deshi wo Nanoru Kenja)
Director of Photography: Miyabi Amada (Odd Taxi, Love All Play)
Editing: Yoshiaki Kimura (Horimiya, Sabikui Bisco)
Sound Director: Tsuyoshi Takahashi (Shinmai Maou no Testament, Beelzebub)
Sound Production: Bit grooove promotion
Music: Yuuko Takahashi (Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shoumei shitemita. Heart), Takuma Sogi (Shichisei no Subaru), hisakuni (Battle Athletess Daiundoukai ReSTART!), Riko Oohashi, Kanji Eguchi, Shari
Music Production: SUPA LOVE
Production Cooperation: Jankon Jantama, Taiyou Giken Co., Ltd.
Studio: OLM

Synopsis
Jippensha Nashiko, a high school girl living in Onomichi City, Hiroshima Prefecture, was in trouble after being kicked out of her house. She said, "I don't have a place to hang out with my friends..." When Naoko learned that the parlor that her father used to run was now vacant, she decided to rebuild it into a place where everyone could gather. (Source: Official Site, translated, edited)

Teaser PV


Official site: https://ponnomichi-pr.com/
Official Twitter: @ponnomichi_pr

Source: Comic Natalie

title: PV Collection for May 15 - 21
text:
Here is a collection of promotional videos, television ads, teasers, and trailers that were released last week. This thread excludes videos that have already been featured in an article. Please check the News Board, under the Preview tag, for articles that feature a promotional video. Last week's PV thread can be found here.

Jujutsu Kaisen 2nd Season | TV | PV
The promotional video for the second season of Jujutsu Kaisen previews the series' opening theme song by Tatsuya Kitani, titled "Ao no Sumika." The television anime produced by MAPPA begins airing on July 6 at 11:56 p.m. via MBS and TBS.




Mononogatari 2nd Season | TV | PV
The official website of Mononogatari released a promotional video for its second season on Thursday. The series' opening and ending theme songs "Ta ga Tame" by Megatera Zero and "Private Room" by Azusa Tadokoro, respectively, are both featured in the video alongside the cast. Bandai Namco Pictures is producing the television anime that premieres in Summer 2023.




Paradox Live the Animation | TV | Teaser
A teaser video for the Paradox Live multimedia project was released through the franchise's official website on Sunday. The video previews scenes from the PINE JAM produced television anime that is set to air in Fall 2023.




Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan (2023) | TV | PV
The fourth promotional video for LIDENFILMS's anime adaptation of Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan previews the cast and highlights the series' ending theme song by Reol, titled "Kissaki." The video also reveals that the television anime is set to premiere on July 7 at 12:55 a.m. via Fuji TV's noitaminA programming block.




Seishun Buta Yarou wa Odekake Sister no Yume wo Minai | Movie | Trailer
The official website for the Seishun Buta Yarou franchise released the second trailer for its feature film Seishun Buta Yarou wa Odekake Sister no Yume wo Minai (Rascal Does Not Dream of a Sister Venturing Out) on Sunday. Produced by CloverWorks, the film is scheduled to make its theatrical debut in Japan on June 23.




Yoru no Kurage wa Oyogenai | TV | Teaser
A teaser video and key visual for Doga Kobo's original anime Yoru no Kurage wa Oyogenai (Jellyfish Can't Swim in the Night) were released through the series' official website on Friday. The television anime is slated for 2024.

title: 'Eiyuu Kyoushitsu' Announces Additional Cast
text:
The official website of the Eiyuu Kyoushitsu (Class Room✿For Heroes) television anime revealed on Monday ten additional cast, second key visual (pictured), and a characters promotional video. The anime is set to premiere in July 2023.

Cast
Maria/Mao: Sarah Emi Bridcutt (Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari)
Iona: Aya Uchida (Trinity Seven)
Claire: Eri Yukimura (Leadale no Daichi nite)
Yessica: Haruka Shiraishi (Shuumatsu no Harem)
Clay: Shuuichi Uchida (Fuufu Ijou, Koibito Miman.)
Cassim: Tomohiro Ono (Tomodachi Game)
Leonard: Tomohito Takatsuka (The iDOLM@STER SideM)
Eliza: Konomi Kohara (Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu)
King Gilgamesh: Rikiya Koyama (Kingdom)
Asmodeus: Tetsu Inada (Bleach)

Keiichirou Kawaguchi (Higurashi no Naku Koro ni Gou) is directing the television anime at Actas. Naoki Hayashi (Citrus) is handling the series composition and script. Kousuke Kawamura (Island) is designing the characters and Koutarou Nakagawa (Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry) is composing the music.

The anime series adapts Shin Araki's school-themed action fantasy light novel, which launched under Shueisha's Dash X Bunko imprint in January 2015, featuring illustrations by Haruyuki Morisawa (Toaru Hikuushi e no Koiuta). The 13th volume was released on July 22.

Ultra Jump serialized a seven-chapter manga adaptation by Takashi Minakuchi from February to August 2015. Koara Kishida began a new manga adaptation in Monthly Shounen Gangan in September 2016. Square Enix published the 15th volume on August 10.

Characters PV


Source: Comic Natalie

title: Sunao Katabuchi's New Anime Movie Unveils Title, Teaser Visual
text:
The MAPPA Stage 2023 event revealed the title, a teaser visual (pictured), and the production video for Sunao Katabuchi's new movie on Sunday—Tsurubamiiro no Nagiko-tachi (The Mourning Children: Nagiko and the Girls Wearing Tsurubami Black).

Staff
Director, Script: Sunao Katabuchi
Assistant Director: Chie Uratani (Kono Sekai no Katasumi ni)
Animation Director: Masashi Andou (Kimi no Na wa.)
Art Director: Toshiharu Mizutani (Akira)
Music: Akira Senju (Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood)
Studio: Contrail

Katabuchi established animation studio Contrail in September 2019. Manabu Ootsuka, the representative director at MAPPA, was named the CEO of the new studio, with Katabuchi and his wife Uratani listed as board members.

Katabuchi's latest movie produced at MAPPA, Kono Sekai no Katasumi ni (In This Corner of the World), opened in theaters in November 2016, followed by an extended version in December 2019. Shout! Factory licensed the movie in North America and co-released it in theaters with Funimation in August 2017.

Production Trailer


Official site: https://tsurubami.contrail.tokyo/

Source: Oricon News
